items.title: Tested: Nomad Find My Tracking Card Pro – metal build and 16-month battery life, but a touch thicker
items.summary:
I love me some Find My, and perhaps the most useful implementation of it in my life has come by way of those wonderful wallet tracker cards. Nomad’s Tracking Card (now known as the Tracking Card Air) has been a staple in my everyday carry for years and something I never leave the house without. However, the brand debuted a new Pro model this year with a metal build and much longer battery life and I have now had a chance to put this thing to the test, so let’s take a look to see if it is worth the higher price tag?

But we wanted to touch down this morning to highlight Woot’s deal on the new Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 for Switch. This regularly $70 bundle is relatively rarely on sale outside of these Woot offers and it has now dropped a touch lower at $58.99 Prime shipped. This is the proper U.S. boxed edition at the lowest price we can find – it is currently down at $59.49 shipped via a third-party Walmart if you would prefer to take that route. There is only a Switch version, but there is also a FREE Switch 2 update you can download that “leverages the Nintendo Switch 2’s processing capabilities for an even better adventure.”

Update 12/26: Amazon’s Lightning deal on the Donkey Kong and Pauline: Donkey Kong Bananza Series amiibo is still live at $19.99.

A rare Amazon price drop is now live on the new Donkey Kong and Pauline: Donkey Kong Bananza Series amiibo at $19.99 with free shipping for Prime members or in orders over $35. This is a limited-time Lightning Deal that will disappear once the discounted stock has depleted. 

more…

items.title: Google’s Hazel Pixel Buds Pro 2 still down at the best price of the season, now $165 (Nearly 30% off)
items.summary:
Some of the best Christmas deals this year landed on Google’s latest Pixel 10 lineup when Amazon decided to throw up some bonus $100 on-page coupons across just about every model in the lineup. Those offers are largely still live, but another highlight offer from the latest Pixel lineup delivers the dark Hazel Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 down at $165 shipped, and that offer is also still up for grabs.

items.summary:
In conjunction with the New Year’s Eve 2026 celebrations, Rapid KL has announced that it will be extending the operating hours of its rail service. This affects 20 stations across five lines, which will be operating until 2AM of 1 January 2026. The BRT Sunway line, selected bus routes and the Rapid KL On-Demand (ROD) […]

items.title: Amazon has AirPods Pro 3 down at $199.50 shipped right now, but likely not for long
items.summary:
Amazon is now offering AirPods Pro 3 down at $199.49 shipped– that’s within $0.50 of the lowest price it has offered them for since release.

items.title: Best Buy launches new Year-End Sale: Apple gear, smart TVs, headphones, gaming, more
items.summary:
Best Buy has now transitioned its holiday event over to a Year-End Sale that is now live through January 1, 2026. While of the big ticket tech deals aren’t quite deep as they were in the lead up to Christmas, there are still loads of discounts across just about every product category that can get a bit sweeter if you’re looking to use up those Best Buy gift cards you might have received in your stocking and holiday cards.

items.summary:
With Christmas now behind us, next up is New Years and this year’s 2025 Target New Year’s Eve ad has arrived. Amazon also now launched a sort of mini New Years store loaded with deals on decorations, apparel, and more, but Target has also now unleashed its latest weekly ad with a host of deals set to go live this weekend.

items.title: Amazon just dropped AirTag down to $19 Prime shipped, or 4-pack at $16 each

This single AirTag listing has been sitting up at $25 for a few weeks now since the Black Friday deals, but it has dropped down to $19 Prime shipped as of this morning.

items.title: Switch holiday game deals from $22: Super Mario Galaxy bundle, Hollow Knight Silksong, Hades II, more
items.summary:
As you may know, Nintendo launched its official holiday game sale yesterday and we are now tracking a host of solid price drops on both new Switch 2 releases and catalogue titles. Many of these deals are also now live at Best Buy (as per usual) and we are getting another chance at the new Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 courtesy of Woot down at $59.99 Prime shipped (it’s a touch more pricey over at Best Buy right now, and this is the proper boxed U.S. version from Woot). You can scope out the new Nintendo Hits for the Holidays Sale right here, but you’ll find all of the best deals waiting below. 

Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $50 off w/ holiday delivery, Switch game deals, more
